about.name: Luxor
about.info_text: Luxor, often referred to as the world's greatest open-air museum, is a city located in the Nile Valley of Egypt. It is renowned for its rich historical and archaeological significance, with a legacy that dates back thousands of years. Luxor is home to a plethora of ancient temples, monuments, and tombs, making it a prime destination for history enthusiasts and travelers seeking to immerse themselves in Egypt's fascinating past.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 506,588
Governorate: Luxor Governorate
Time Zone: Eastern European Time (UTC+02:00)
Language: Arabic
Currency: Egyptian Pound (EGP)
about.climate_text: Luxor experiences a desert climate, characterized by scorching summers and mild winters. It is a year-round destination, but the cooler months from November to March are particularly pleasant for outdoor exploration.

attractions_card.title: Karnak Temple
attractions_card.description: Karnak Temple is a vast complex of ancient temples and chapels dedicated to various Egyptian deities. It is one of the largest religious buildings ever constructed and a remarkable testament to Egypt's architectural prowess.

attractions_card.title: Luxor Temple
attractions_card.description: Luxor Temple is an enchanting temple complex located in the heart of Luxor. It features beautifully preserved statues, obelisks, and towering columns.

attractions_card.title: Valley of the Kings
attractions_card.description: The Valley of the Kings is an ancient burial site where many pharaohs of the New Kingdom era were entombed, including the famous Tutankhamun.

attractions_card.title: Valley of the Queens
attractions_card.description: The Valley of the Queens is the burial place of queens, princesses, and other royal family members, featuring beautifully decorated tombs.

attractions_card.title: Hatshepsut's Temple
attractions_card.description: Hatshepsut's Temple is a stunning mortuary temple dedicated to the female pharaoh Hatshepsut, set against the cliffs of Deir el-Bahri.

attractions_card.title: Colossi of Memnon
attractions_card.description: The Colossi of Memnon are two massive stone statues of Pharaoh Amenhotep III, standing as guardians of his temple.

attractions_card.title: Medinet Habu
attractions_card.description: Medinet Habu is an archaeological site featuring a temple, palace, and a series of reliefs, providing insights into ancient Egyptian history.

attractions_card.title: Luxor Museum
attractions_card.description: The Luxor Museum houses a fascinating collection of artifacts, statues, and mummies from Luxor's ancient history.

food_card.title: Koshari
food_card.description: Koshari is a popular Egyptian dish made of lentils, rice, macaroni, and spicy tomato sauce, garnished with fried onions.

food_card.title: Ful Medames
food_card.description: Ful Medames is a hearty breakfast dish made from fava beans, typically served with olive oil, lemon juice, and spices.

food_card.title: Shawarma
food_card.description: Shawarma is a flavorful street food consisting of thinly sliced, seasoned meat typically served in pita bread with various toppings and sauces.

food_card.title: Baklava
food_card.description: Baklava is a sweet and rich pastry made of layers of phyllo dough, nuts, and honey, offering a delightful dessert experience.

food_card.title: Molokhia
food_card.description: Molokhia is a traditional Egyptian soup made from jute leaves, often served with rice or bread and seasoned with garlic and coriander.

hotels_card.title: Sofitel Winter Palace Luxor
hotels_card.description: The Sofitel Winter Palace Luxor is an elegant and historic hotel offering luxurious accommodations in a Nile-front setting.

hotels_card.title: Hilton Luxor Resort & Spa
hotels_card.description: The Hilton Luxor Resort & Spa is a riverside resort with modern amenities, offering picturesque views of the Nile River.

hotels_card.title: Steigenberger Nile Palace Luxor
hotels_card.description: Steigenberger Nile Palace Luxor is a comfortable hotel located along the Nile, featuring excellent dining options and a relaxing atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: Sonesta St. George Hotel Luxor
hotels_card.description: The Sonesta St. George Hotel Luxor offers a stylish and convenient stay with stunning river views and top-notch facilities.

transport_card.title: Luxor International Airport
transport_card.description: Luxor International Airport (LXR) is the main gateway for travelers arriving in Luxor, serving domestic and limited international flights.

transport_card.title: Public Transportation
transport_card.description: Public buses and microbuses are common means of transportation within Luxor, providing an affordable way to explore the city.

transport_card.title: Taxi Services
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available for getting around Luxor and are a convenient option for reaching various historical sites.

transport_card.title: Felucca Rides
transport_card.description: Feluccas, traditional wooden sailboats, offer relaxing rides on the Nile River, providing scenic views of the city and its surroundings.
